itemDescription: brother of Victorian-era novelist Charles Dickens

wikipedia_page.main: Alfred Lamert Dickens (March 1822 – 27 July 1860) was an English railway engineer, and was the younger brother of the Victorian novelist Charles Dickens.

response: * Alfred Lamert Dickens, the younger brother of Charles Dickens

The engineer was John Cass Birkinshaw, the assistant engineer Alfred Lamert Dickens. In addition to the mainline from New Malton (on the York and Scarborough Railway) to Great Driffield (on the Hull and Selby Bridlington branch) the plans included a  branch from Frodingham Bridge on the River Hull. On the original plan the minimum curve was   with maximum gradients of 1 in 60, and 1 in 158. The line also included a tunnel of .
